intro: Vaccinium boninense, commonly known as the Bonin heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Bonin Islands, a group of islands located in the Pacific Ocean. This plant is characterized by its low-growing shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clustered flowers. The flowers are typically pink or white, and the plant produces small, dark blue berries. Vaccinium boninense is adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats.
